introduction:
Bayes' theorem explained with examples and implications for life.
Check out Audible: http://ve42.co/

vocabulary.definition: a series of tests or experiments used to determine the condition or capabilities of something
vocabulary.example: The doctor suggested running a battery of tests to diagnose the illness.

vocabulary.definition: results or effects of an action or condition
vocabulary.example: The consequences of not studying for the exam were evident in his failing grade.

vocabulary.definition: existing or occurring before in time or order
vocabulary.example: Your prior experience in sales will be beneficial for this new job.

vocabulary.definition: involving or causing a complete or dramatic change
vocabulary.example: The invention of the internet was revolutionary in shaping the modern world.

vocabulary.definition: the likelihood of something happening or being the case
vocabulary.example: There is a high probability of rain tomorrow based on the weather forecast.

vocabulary.definition: a comparison between two things, typically for the purpose of explanation or clarification
vocabulary.example: She used an analogy of a ship sailing through rough seas to describe the challenges they were facing.
